books.title: Ursule Mirouët
books.author: Honoré de Balzac
books.summary: A young girl grows up in the care of her uncle and his friends, while his heirs scheme to prevent her from inheriting anything.

books.title: The Scarlet Pimpernel
books.author: Baroness Orczy
books.summary: A daring Englishman with a secret identity rescues French aristocrats from the guillotine during the French Revolution.

books.title: The Education of Henry Adams
books.author: Henry Adams
books.summary: A prominent and caustic historian reflects on the reasons that “the more he was educated, the less he understood,” and what he believes the future holds for American society.

books.title: Tombstone
books.author: Walter Noble Burns
books.summary: An embellished retelling of the town of Tombstone, Arizona, during its heyday in the late 19th century, featuring famous heroes and outlaws of the American Old West.

books.title: The Wonderful Adventures of Nils
books.author: Selma Lagerlöf
books.summary: Nils Holgersson, transformed to an elf, learns the meaning of kindness during his adventures with a flock of wild geese.

books.title: Penguin Island
books.author: Anatole France
books.summary: A myopic saint mistakenly baptizes some penguins, ushering in a centuries-spanning satire of French history.

books.title: Man and Superman
books.author: George Bernard Shaw
books.summary: Jack Tanner flees both London and responsibility when he is made guardian of his childhood friend Ann Whitehead.

books.title: Darby O’Gill and the Good People
books.author: Herminie Templeton Kavanagh
books.summary: When Tipperary man Darby O’Gill is imprisoned by the fairies of Sleive-na-mon in their home under the hollow mountain, he starts a lasting friendship with their King Brian Connors.

books.title: Laughing Boy
books.author: Oliver La Farge
books.summary: A young Navajo man meets a mysterious young woman as he enters adulthood during the American expansion into the West.

books.title: Melmoth the Wanderer
books.author: Charles Robert Maturin
books.summary: A set of overlapping tales tell the story of a mysterious, malevolent, ageless stranger.

books.title: A Personal Record
books.author: Joseph Conrad
books.summary: Conrad recounts his childhood in Poland, his sailing experiences, and the work on his debut novel.

books.title: The Paradise Mystery
books.author: J. S. Fletcher
books.summary: A young doctor attempts to turn a mysterious death to his romantic advantage.

books.title: The Story of My Experiments with Truth
books.author: Mahatma Gandhi
books.summary: Gandhi relates his life experiences from his birth in Gujarat in 1869 through the Indian National Congress of 1915.

books.title: Nicomachean Ethics
books.author: Aristotle
books.summary: Aristotle examines how one may live in the most thriving, excellent manner.

books.title: New Hampshire
books.author: Robert Frost
books.summary: Robert Frost’s Pulitzer-winning book of poetry.

books.title: Those Barren Leaves
books.author: Aldous Huxley
books.summary: An aristocrat summons a group of “intelligentsia” to vacation in her Italian mansion.

books.title: Islands of Space
books.author: John W. Campbell
books.summary: Four men become the first humans to travel to other galaxies.

books.title: Lord Peter Views the Body
books.author: Dorothy L. Sayers
books.summary: A collection of short stories in which an aristocratic amateur detective solves a variety of crimes.

books.title: The Story of My Experiments with Truth
books.author: Mahatma Gandhi
books.summary: Gandhi relates his life experiences from his birth in Gujarat in 1869 through the Indian National Congress of 1915.

books.title: Journals
books.author: Alexander Mackenzie
books.summary: Explorer Alexander Mackenzie details his journeys to both the Arctic and Pacific Oceans in his personal journals.
